Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Intestinal \In*tes"ti*nal\, a. [Cf. F. intestinal.] Of or pertaining to the intestines of an animal; as, the intestinal tube; intestinal digestion; intestinal enzymes. [1913 Webster]
{Intestinal canal}. Same as {Intestine}, n.
{Intestinal worm} (Zo["o]l.), any species of helminth living in the intestinal canal of any animal. The species are numerous. [1913 Webster]
intestinal adj : of or relating to or inside the intestines; "intestinal disease" [syn: {enteric}, {enteral}]
